rev.diff:
Line 172: Line 172:
;Application support
;Application support
  +
''See also: [[Virtual Machine]] (allows most Windows software to run "on top of" Linux)''
  +
The November 2006 ''Desktop Linux Client Survey'' identified the foremost barrier for deploying Linux desktops was that users were accustomed to Windows applications which had not been ported to Linux and which they "just can't live without". These included [[Microsoft Office]], [[Adobe Photoshop]], [[Autodesk]] [[AutoCAD]], [[Microsoft Project]], [[Visio]] and [[Intuit]] [[QuickBooks]].<ref name="OSDL 2006" /><ref>{{cite news | first=Steven J. | last=Vaughan-Nichols | coauthors= | title=Where are the American Linux desktop users? | date=[[2007-10-23]] | publisher=Ziff Davis Enterprise Holdings Inc. | url =http://www.desktoplinux.com/news/NS2619861157.html | work =DesktopLinux.com | pages = | accessdate = 2007-11-19 | language = }}</ref>
The November 2006 ''Desktop Linux Client Survey'' identified the foremost barrier for deploying Linux desktops was that users were accustomed to Windows applications which had not been ported to Linux and which they "just can't live without". These included [[Microsoft Office]], [[Adobe Photoshop]], [[Autodesk]] [[AutoCAD]], [[Microsoft Project]], [[Visio]] and [[Intuit]] [[QuickBooks]].<ref name="OSDL 2006" /><ref>{{cite news | first=Steven J. | last=Vaughan-Nichols | coauthors= | title=Where are the American Linux desktop users? | date=[[2007-10-23]] | publisher=Ziff Davis Enterprise Holdings Inc. | url =http://www.desktoplinux.com/news/NS2619861157.html | work =DesktopLinux.com | pages = | accessdate = 2007-11-19 | language = }}</ref>
In a DesktopLinux.com survey conducted in 2007, 72% of respondents said they used ways to run Windows applications on Linux.<ref> {{cite web|url=http://www.desktoplinux.com/cgi-bin/survey/survey.cgi?view=archive&id=0813200712407 |title=2007 Desktop Linux Market survey |accessdate=2007-12-11 |date=2007-08-21 |work=DesktopLinux.com |publisher=Ziff Davis Enterprise Holdings Inc }}</ref>
In a DesktopLinux.com survey conducted in 2007, 72% of respondents said they used ways to run Windows applications on Linux.<ref> {{cite web|url=http://www.desktoplinux.com/cgi-bin/survey/survey.cgi?view=archive&id=0813200712407 |title=2007 Desktop Linux Market survey |accessdate=2007-12-11 |date=2007-08-21 |work=DesktopLinux.com |publisher=Ziff Davis Enterprise Holdings Inc }}</ref>
